content: quick classy cowl continuous crochet cowl this pattern uses us terminology i have included a us/uk conversion chart for quick reference designed by daina mickus you can find me on ravelry as missyddesigns@gmail com quick classy cowl pattern size you can make it to any size you want by adjusting the length of the foundation chain the cowl i have made in this example is 63cm/25 long hook one and a half sizes larger than recommended hook size for yarn i have used a 5 5mm hook with dk yarn yarn any weight yarn in the example i have used ice yarn dancing baby special stitches single_crochet blo work a single single_crochet in back loops only us terms uk terms single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet abbreviations chain = chain blo = back loop only pattern start with a chain of 190 if you want to make the cowl longer or shorter adjust the number of chains you start off with i put a stitch marker in the start and end of the chain and measure it around my neck to check the length pic 1 round 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook single_crochet to end of chain in top loop of chain round 2 join two ends of single_crochet chain with single_crochet in blo back loop only to last single_crochet in foundation chain as per pic 2 make sure you do not twist the chain before joining continue single_crochet in blo ina continuous round until the width you desire is reached i count row from the join this cowl has 20 row finsh off and weave in ends page 2 quick classy cowl pattern reference pictures pic 1 stitch marker in first pic 2 joining end of and last loop for measuring foundation single_crochet to start with an length single_crochet blo as indicated pic 3 stitch marker indicates where to join 1st single_crochet blo on foundation single_crochet chain close up of stitch entire cowl laid out 63cm long page 3
